The important question to ask here is whether the component or proportional strategies should be chosen by policy-makers. Figs 3 and 4 show in some networks at particular ranges of sampling percentages that the global strategy is not the best choice on average. We find, however, that the distribution of values, Φ
A and Φ
B , over all performed simulations have large standard deviations. Hence, the values shown in these figures do not give a good indication of which strategy would give a better outcome for one particular network sample; as this is all we would expect to have in reality. The following section proposes a way to deal with this issue.
